summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office detailing the schedule for three upcoming oral arguments before the Second Circuit Court of Appeals for the week of October 12-16, 2020. It includes a case involving Ghislaine Maxwell, concerning a pre-trial appeal on a protective order.

persons.name: Farhane
persons.context: Individual appealing the denial of a Section 2255 motion raising an ineffective assistance of counsel claim related to denaturalization advice.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'D' in the case United States v. Maxwell, involved in a pre-trial appeal regarding the modification of a protective order.

persons.name: Louis McIntosh
persons.context: Individual involved in an appeal and cross-appeal concerning Hobbs Act robbery, Section 924(c), and forfeiture procedures.

persons.name: Winter
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the Farhane v. United States oral argument.

persons.name: Walker
persons.context: Listed as a judge on panels for both the Farhane v. United States and United States v. Louis McIntosh oral arguments.

persons.name: Menashi
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the Farhane v. United States oral argument.

persons.name: Cabranes
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the United States v. Maxwell oral argument.

persons.name: Pooler
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the United States v. Maxwell oral argument.

persons.name: Raggi
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the United States v. Maxwell oral argument.

persons.name: Lohier
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the United States v. Louis McIntosh oral argument.

persons.name: Stanceu
persons.context: Listed as a judge on the panel for the United States v. Louis McIntosh oral argument.

connections.description: Judge Cabranes is part of the appellate panel hearing Maxwell's pre-trial appeal regarding a protective order.
Judge Pooler is part of the appellate panel hearing Maxwell's pre-trial appeal regarding a protective order.
Judge Raggi is part of the appellate panel hearing Maxwell's pre-trial appeal regarding a protective order.

events.title: Oral Argument in United States v. Maxwell
events.description: Pre-trial appeal hearing before the Second Circuit regarding whether the district court's order denying Maxwell's motion to modify a protective order is subject to interlocutory appeal and whether the court abused its discretion.

events.title: Oral Argument in Farhane v. United States
events.description: Appeal hearing on the denial of a certificate of appealability for a Section 2255 motion raising an ineffective assistance of counsel claim.

events.title: Oral Argument in United States v. Louis McIntosh
events.description: Appeal and cross-appeal hearing concerning sufficiency of evidence for Hobbs Act robbery, a Davis challenge, a Rehaif challenge, and forfeiture procedures.

keyFacts: The document schedules a key pre-trial appellate hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell's case for October 13, 2020.
The Maxwell appeal focuses on the denial of a motion to modify a protective order and its appealability.
The hearings were to be conducted remotely via phone/Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic in October 2020.
The document originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office, indicating internal coordination for upcoming court arguments.
